question_text: What is the role of a prototype program in problem solving

reference_responses.reference_response: To simulate the behaviour of portions of the desired software product

question_text: What stages in the software life cycle are influenced by the testing stage

reference_responses.reference_response: The testing stage can influence both the coding stage - LRB - phase 5 - RRB - and the solution refinement stage - LRB - phase 7 - RRB -

question_text: What are the main advantages associated with object - oriented programming

reference_responses.reference_response: Abstraction and reusability

question_text: Where do C plus plus programs begin to execute

reference_responses.reference_response: At the main function

question_text: What is a variable

reference_responses.reference_response: A location in memory that can store a value

question_text: Where are variables declared in a C plus plus program

reference_responses.reference_response: Variables can be declared anywhere in a program They can be declared inside a function - LRB - local variables - RRB - or outside the functions - LRB - global variables - RRB -

question_text: What is the main difference between a while and a do while statement

reference_responses.reference_response: The block inside a do while statement will execute at least once

question_text: What is a tree

reference_responses.reference_response: A collection of nodes which has a special node called root and the rest of the nodes are partitioned into one or more disjoint sets each set being a tree

question_text: What is the height of a tree

reference_responses.reference_response: The length of the longest path from the root to any of its leaves

question_text: What is a leaf

reference_responses.reference_response: A node that has no children

question_text: What is a binary tree

reference_responses.reference_response: A tree for which the maximum number of children per node is two

question_text: What is a binary search tree

reference_responses.reference_response: A binary tree that has the property that for any node the left child is smaller than the parent which in turn is smaller than the right child

question_text: What is the inorder traversal of a binary tree

reference_responses.reference_response: Traverse the left subtree then the root then the right subtree

question_text: How many comparisons does it take to find an element in a binary search tree

reference_responses.reference_response: The height of the tree - LRB - or log of the number of elements in the tree - RRB -

question_text: What are the elements typically included in a class definition

reference_responses.reference_response: Function members and data members

question_text: Briefly describe in one sentence how does merge sort work

reference_responses.reference_response: It splits the original array into two sorts each of the two halves and then merges the sorted arrays

question_text: What are the access - specifiers that can be used in a C plus plus class definition

reference_responses.reference_response: Private and public

question_text: How are objects initialized when they are created

reference_responses.reference_response: By using constructors

question_text: What is a function signature

reference_responses.reference_response: The name of the function and the list of parameters including their types

question_text: What is a recursive function

reference_responses.reference_response: A function that calls itself

question_text: What is the alternative way to solve a problem that could be solved through recursive functions

reference_responses.reference_response: Through iteration

question_text: What is the difference between an array that is declared as static and one that is not

reference_responses.reference_response: The static arrays are intialized only once when the function is called

question_text: What is the main difference between a string of characters that is read into a variable of type string versus a variable of type char

reference_responses.reference_response: The char will automatically add a null 0 character at the end of the string

question_text: Briefly describe the divide - and - conquer paradigm

reference_responses.reference_response: Divide a problem into smaller subproblems solve them recursively and then combine the solutions into a solution for the original problem

question_text: What is a pointer

reference_responses.reference_response: The address of a location in memory

question_text: How many steps does it take to search a node in a binary search tree

reference_responses.reference_response: The height of the tree

question_text: What is the experimental approach for measuring the running time of an algorithm

reference_responses.reference_response: Implement the algorithm and measure the physical running time

question_text: Order the following functions by their running time : n to the power of 2; log - LRB - log n - RRB - ; 2 to the power of - LRB - log n - RRB - ; n ! ; n to the power of 3

reference_responses.reference_response: log - LRB - log n - RRB - ; 2 to the power of - LRB - log n - RRB - ; n to the power of 2; n to the power of 3; n !

question_text: Briefly how does selection sort work

reference_responses.reference_response: It selects the minimum from an array and places it on the first position then it selects the minimum from the rest of the array and places it on the second position and so forth

question_text: What is the advantage of linked lists over arrays

reference_responses.reference_response: Linked lists are dynamic structures which allow for a variable number of elements to be stored

question_text: What is a queue

reference_responses.reference_response: A data structure that stores elements following the first in first out principle The main operations in a queue are enqueue and dequeue

question_text: What are the main operations associated with a stack

reference_responses.reference_response: push and pop

question_text: What is the Euler tour traversal of a tree

reference_responses.reference_response: A walk around the tree starting with the root where each node is seen three times : from the left from below from the right

question_text: How do you delete a node from a binary search tree

reference_responses.reference_response: Find the node then replace it with the leftmost node from its right subtree - LRB - or the rightmost node from its left subtree - RRB -

question_text: What is typically included in a class definition

reference_responses.reference_response: Data members - LRB - attributes - RRB - and member functions

question_text: What is the difference between a data member and a local variable inside a member function

reference_responses.reference_response: Data members can be accessed from any member functions inside the class defintion Local variables can only be accessed inside the member function that defines them

question_text: What is the difference between a constructor and a function

reference_responses.reference_response: A constructor is called whenever an object is created whereas a function needs to be called explicitely Constructors do not have return type but functions have to indicate a return type

question_text: When does C plus plus create a default constructor

reference_responses.reference_response: If no constructor is provided the compiler provides one by default If a constructor is defined for a class the compiler does not create a default constructor

question_text: How many constructors can be created for a class

reference_responses.reference_response: Unlimited number

question_text: What is the difference between a function prototype and a function definition

reference_responses.reference_response: A function prototype includes the function signature i e the name of the function the return type and the parameters type The function definition includes the actual body of the function

question_text: What is the role of a header - file

reference_responses.reference_response: To store a class interface including data members and member function prototypes

question_text: What does a function signature include

reference_responses.reference_response: The name of the function and the types of the parameters

question_text: What is the scope of global variables

reference_responses.reference_response: File scope

question_text: How does the compiler handle inline functions

reference_responses.reference_response: It makes a copy of the function code in every place where a function call is made

question_text: What is the main advantage associated with function arguments that are passed by reference

reference_responses.reference_response: It avoids making copies of large data structures when calling functions

question_text: How are overloaded functions differentiated by the compiler

reference_responses.reference_response: Based on the function signature When an overloaded function is called the compiler will find the function whose signature is closest to the given function call

question_text: When defining a recursive function what are possible causes for infinite recursion

reference_responses.reference_response: If the recursion step is defined incorrectly or if the base case is not included

question_text: What are the similarities between iteration and recursion

reference_responses.reference_response: They both involve repetition; they both have termination tests; they can both occur infinitely

question_text: What are the two different ways of specifying the length of an array

reference_responses.reference_response: In the array declaration or by using an initializer list

question_text: What is the main difference between strings declared using the type string versus strings declared using an array of characters

reference_responses.reference_response: The strings declared using an array of characters have a null element added at the end of the array

question_text: How are arrays passed to functions

reference_responses.reference_response: by reference

question_text: What is the difference between an array declared as static and one that is not

reference_responses.reference_response: The arrays declared as static live throughout the life of the program; that is they are initialized only once when the function that declares the array it is first called

question_text: How many dimensions need to be specified when passing a multi - dimensional array as an argument to a function

reference_responses.reference_response: All the dimensions except the first one

question_text: Using an index outside the bounds of the array generates an error Is this a compilation error or a run - time error

reference_responses.reference_response: Run - time error

question_text: How are bi - dimensional arrays stored in memory by rows or by columns

reference_responses.reference_response: By rows

question_text: In one sentence what is the main idea implemented by insertion sort

reference_responses.reference_response: Taking one array element at a time from left to right it inserts it in the right position among the already sorted elements on its left

question_text: In one sentence what is the main idea implemented by selection sort

reference_responses.reference_response: Taking one array element at a time from left to right it identifies the minimum from the remaining elements and swaps it with the current element

question_text: What is the number of operations for insertion sort under a best - case scenario and what is the best - case scenario

reference_responses.reference_response: N - LRB - the length of the array - RRB - operations achieved for a sorted array

question_text: What is the base case for a recursive implementation of merge sort

reference_responses.reference_response: When the size of the array to be sorted is 1 - LRB - or 2 - RRB -

question_text: What does the address - LRB - ADDRESS - RRB - operator return

reference_responses.reference_response: The memory address of its operand

question_text: What does the star - LRB - STAR - RRB - operator return

reference_responses.reference_response: An alias - LRB - synonym - RRB - for the name of the object that its operand points to in memory It is the dereferencing operator

question_text: How can an array be addressed in pointer or offset notation

reference_responses.reference_response: By initializing a pointer to point to the first element of the array and then incrementing this pointer with the index of the array element

question_text: What does the sizeof operator return

reference_responses.reference_response: The size in bytes of its operand

question_text: What are the different ways to pass a pointer to a function

reference_responses.reference_response: There are four ways : nonconstant pointer to constant data nonconstant pointer to nonconstant data constant pointer to constant data constant pointer to nonconstant data

question_text: What is a function pointer

reference_responses.reference_response: The address of the location in memory where the function code resides

question_text: What is a linked list

reference_responses.reference_response: A collection of elements that can be allocated dynamically

question_text: What is the main advantage of linked lists over arrays

reference_responses.reference_response: The linked lists can be of variable length

question_text: What is the main advantage of arrays over linked lists

reference_responses.reference_response: The elements in an array can be accessed directly - LRB - as opposed to linked lists which require iterative traversal - RRB -

question_text: How are linked lists passed as arguments to a function

reference_responses.reference_response: By reference

question_text: What is the difference between a circular linked list and a basic linked list

reference_responses.reference_response: The last element in a circular linked list points to the head of the list

question_text: What is the main advantage of a doubly - linked list over a basic linked list

reference_responses.reference_response: All the deletion and insertion operations can be performed in constant time including those operations performed before a given location in the list or at the end of the list

question_text: What is the main disadvantage of a doubly - linked list over a basic linked list

reference_responses.reference_response: Extra space required to store the back pointers

question_text: What is a stack

reference_responses.reference_response: A data structure that can store elements which has the property that the last item added will be the first to be removed - LRB - or last - in - first - out - RRB -

question_text: What are the two main functions defined by a stack

reference_responses.reference_response: Push and pop are two main functions defined in a stack

question_text: How can you implement a stack with an array

reference_responses.reference_response: Keep the top of the stack toward the end of the array so the push and pop operations will add or remove elements from the right side of the array

question_text: How can you implement a stack with a list

reference_responses.reference_response: Keep the top of the stack pointing to the head of the linked list so the push and pop operations will add or remove elements at the beginning of the list

question_text: Which implementation - LRB - array - based vs list - based - RRB - is preferred and why

reference_responses.reference_response: Link - based because they are dynamic - LRB - no size constraints - RRB -

question_text: How are infix expressions evaluated by computers

reference_responses.reference_response: First they are converted into postfix form followed by an evaluation of the postfix expression

question_text: What operations would you need to perform to find a given element on a stack

reference_responses.reference_response: Pop all the elements and store them on another stack until the element is found then push back all the elements on the original stack

question_text: What are the two main functions defined by a queue

reference_responses.reference_response: enqueue and dequeue

question_text: How can you implement a queue with an array

reference_responses.reference_response: Use a circular array Keep the rear of the queue toward the end of the array and the front toward the beginning and allow the rear pointer to wrap around

question_text: How can you implement a queue with a list

reference_responses.reference_response: Keep the rear of the queue pointing to the tail of the linked list so the enqueue operation is done at the end of the list and keep the front of the queue pointing to the head of the linked list so the dequeue operation is done at the beginning of the list

question_text: Which implementation - LRB - array - based vs list - based - RRB - is preferred for a queue and why

reference_responses.reference_response: Link - based because they are dynamic - LRB - no size constraints - RRB -

question_text: What is the stack operation corresponding to the enqueue operation in queues

reference_responses.reference_response: push

question_text: What data structure is more appropriate for scheduling printing jobs at a printer a stack or a queue

reference_responses.reference_response: queue
